fields.description:
Need to modify how this calculation is done so that the operation will offer to take users to Plan Mode.

Q : Would the epic be selected? That could be strange as it would apply filtering.
A : no, the epic is not selected

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Make sure to be searching by an issue id, not epic name to prevent searching on duplicate names.
A: (/) sure, searched by issue id

Q: How performant is this across many boards, like JAC?
A: (/) hard to say, but we basically added only one clause to the query. It shouldn't perform very differently from what is already deployed on JAC. Needs verification tough.

Q: What if the Epics Panel is collapsed?
A: (/) the panel is opened and the epic is selected. It means that issues that are not in the epic are filtered out

Q: What if the user does not have permission to see a board/project that the Epic is involved with?
A: (x) [~pobara], not sure how to produce this case, let's speak together about that
fields.summary: The "View on Board" link for an epic does not take you to any scrum boards, despite the epic appearing in the Epic Panel in plan mode
Investigate rebanding (font size change strangeness) when dot dialog, quick filter other actions occur

fields.description: Once the Epic Report has been implemented, have a link in the Agile web panel to open the report for the current epic. Like sprint links, it should open a dialog with the board options if there are multiple boards.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a quick link to an epic's Epic Report on the View Issue page

fields.description:
Steps:

# Have a board which looks at multiple projects
# Have epics from multiple projects
# Change permission scheme for one project so that you do not have Edit Issue permission
# Attempt to edit the epic from that project

Input is cleared. This is different to an issue you do have permission to edit, where the current value is kept.

If we're going to allow them to start editing, but then show an error, it might look a bit weird to also show them no input when we know it's going to fail.
fields.summary: Initiating inline edit on an issue I don't have permission to edit clears the text input

fields.description: Just feels a little weird that you can continue doing other epic things while the validation error is there. I know that this is the same as other inline edit controls in our app.
fields.summary: OPINION - if Epic Label has validation error, and another epic is selected (for filtering), should that cancel the edit?

fields.description:
Steps:

# Load Plan Mode with no epic filter
# Filter on an epic
# Inline edit that epic
# Unselect that epic

Issues are not restored
fields.summary: Inline Edit breaks filtering of issues
Inline Edit clears "Hidden by filter" message

fields.description: If you have many users creating boards and they are using the same Quick Filters, it would be useful to be able to specify default Quick Filters for all boards.
fields.summary: As a user I would to be able to set default quick filters for all boards

fields.description: Currently, when a Sprint is started, no email notification is sent and no event is fired. It would be good to have this, to have more control over who receives an email and what systems are notified.
fields.summary: Add a "Start Sprint" notification/event

fields.description:
*Situation:* When mouse-hovering over events in the burndown chart, the pop-up shows only the related Issue ID (e.g. JEN-0815) (and some details about the actual change, of course)

*Problem:* One probably does not know which task/issue that is. The ID alone is not really helpful.

*Suggestion:* Add the title to the pop-ups.

*Value:*
Ability to efficiently understand details of the chart, especially helpful when:
- understanding the team’s progress (is a “sub task” done, or a whole “topic”/feature, ...?)
- could I offer someone a review?
- checking on scope violations
- ...
fields.summary: Improve mouse hover information in burn-down charts

fields.description:
To replicate the exact error, one must access the URL http://<BASE-URL>/secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa with the IssueID argument. The URL generally has an argument, as in http://<BASE-URL>/secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa?issueId=10001.  Without the argument (issueId=10001), JIRA will throw a null value error. 

{noformat}
2012-09-19 09:47:00,328 http-8080-8 ERROR anonymous 587x91259x3 - xx.xxx.xx.xx,127.0.0.1 /secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa [velocity] Left side ($action.numBoards) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/greenhopper/web/board/rapid/board-selector.vm [line 8, column 69]
2012-09-19 09:47:00,703 http-8080-4 ERROR anonymous 587x91263x1 - xx.xxx.xx.xx,127.0.0.1 /secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa [velocity] Left side ($action.numBoards) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/greenhopper/web/board/rapid/board-selector.vm [line 8, column 69]
2012-09-19 09:47:00,971 http-8080-47 ERROR anonymous 587x91266x2 - xx.xxx.xx.xx,127.0.0.1 /secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa [velocity] Left side ($action.numBoards) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/greenhopper/web/board/rapid/board-selector.vm [line 8, column 69]
{noformat}

JIRA should be robust against incorrect URLs.

The following condition check in the board-selector.vm will throw an incompatible format error:
{code}
        #if ($action.hasAnyErrors() == false || $action.numBoards == 0)
            ##POSSIBLEXSS
            <script>
                ## Fire analytics event for loading the board selector page
                (function(){
{code}

As the numBoards is currently return a NULL value rather than a numeric value.


h3. The fix

It seems that this has been fixed in JIRA 5.1.x as it uses a new velocity render
fields.summary: "board-selector.vm" velocity file does not handle empty value properly

fields.description:
There will be an Epic Report with three sections:

- 1: Epic progress chart
** Starts at epic creation time
** finishes on current date
** line for issue count
** line for unestimated issue count
** line for total amount of estimated work (using selected estimation statistic)
** line for completed work (using selected estimation statistic)
** tooltips will be like the sprint burndown
** show non-working days markings

This means we have two vertical scales (count and estimate)

- 2: Summary of current epic status 
** Looks like the current statistics in the plan mode

- 3: Table showing all issues currently assigned with the current status (done in GHS-6616)

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens with stories that were moved/deleted/converted to subtasks and vice versa, and how is this displayed in the table?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Are there any maximums to the table length, in terms of issuekey/number of issues/etc? Can you break these limits?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if the Epic itself was closed/done then reopened? Is the report still available and is there any indication about this history?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What if editing another issuetype into an epic or vice versa?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Are reports generated dynamically?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What happens if I visit the report URL for another non-epic?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Single Epic Progress Report

fields.description:
Show the status of each Epic in the board, along with the number of stories, complete vs incomplete, estimated vs unestimated 

Include done Epics

Link from each Epic to the Single Epic Report for that Epic
fields.summary: All Epic Progress Report

fields.description: Capturing analytics events will not occur until a page reload happens.
fields.summary: Enabling analytics on Getting Started page should trigger page reload so that analytics resources are loaded

fields.description:
It would be awesome to have an entry on the Epic area, let's call it 'Ungrouped', which when clicked shows all the items which are not mapped to an Epic.
Found that it is painful to scroll down the entire backlog to find the right issue, click and drag it all the way to top to drop it to the right Epic issue.
- When an item is dragged and dropped on it, it will be unassociated from any Epic it's currently connected to

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What happens to this item when there are no epics assigned to it? Will there be a way to tell it is empty without selecting it?
A: (/) No, it does not have a count.

Q: So clicking the x on an epic link will automatically add that issue to the unlinked epic?
A: (/) Correct (v good note)

Q: Will the unlinked epic update with the new addition in the case above if it is currently selected?
A: (/) Yes

Q: Will this only include issues within the backlog or also issues in the work mode?
A: (/) Epic filtering is for all issues in Plan mode so includes active sprints listed at top

Q: Does the board require a refresh in order to display these newly linked issues?
A: (/) Uses same update as epic filtering = not a full page reload
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see which issues are not linked to an Epic in the plan mode

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
As a user, currently if you have the 'edit issues' permission, you can 'remove an issue from sprint' from a GreenHopper board (work mode) and JIRA admins are concerned about this feature, they want to restrict this to few users. Users with 'schedule permission' and 'Administer Projects' permission would be valuable to restrict this operation, as this is currently spread to all users with 'Edit issues' permissions.

*Expected Results:*
Admins to have restrictions options to perform this operation, such as it can change the way sprints are worked.

*Actual Results:*
All users with 'edit issues' permissions can change it now, and if you take it off from them, then they will have too much restrictions to work.
fields.summary: Restrict 'Remove Issue from Sprint' operation to users with Schedule permission / Administer Projects permission

fields.description:
COS:
* ensure that multiple issues are handled
fields.summary: Restrict drag and drop Add Issue to Sprint to users with Schedule permission for those issue(s)

fields.description: If you have pre-planned sprints A, B, and C, in that order, and later decide to do sprint C before sprint B, there's doesn't appear to be any way to move sprint C ahead of sprint B in Plan mode.
fields.summary: Add ability to change order of pre-planned sprints

fields.description: We need the ability to allow only the Product Owner or specific users the ability to rank the backlog. All other users should not be allow to rank the backlog, i.e. move items within the backlog they should however be able to move the items on the task boards . Your current 'Schedule' permissions does not satisfy this requirement so please don't close this issue telling me that is the solution, it is not. I am considering this a defect since your current solution does not satisfy the requirement.
fields.summary: Permissions for Backlog Ranking do not work properly

fields.description: As in JIRA and Confluence, I would like the ability to identify Boards as favorites and have a UI that allowed me to quickly navigate to one of my Favorite Boards without having to locate it in the list or put a link elsewhere on a wiki page. With so many boards, it can take a bit to navigate through the list to locate the one needed.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to identify Favorite boards and ability to view favorites for quick navigation

fields.description:
As we use the voting facility of JIRA/Greenhopper to get a guideline when ordering/ranking the backlog in Planning mode in the agile board, we would love to see the number of votes on the agile board (only planning mode).

For this prupose we could go into two directions:
* display the number of votes in all cards in the backlog (configurable?)
* display the number of votes in the detail view of the agile board.

The latter is acceptable and probably easier to get.

We recommend put this in the People section of the Info area.  We'll link the tally directly to the voters page just as JIRA View Issue does.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to display the number of votes in the agile board.

fields.description: Would be great if we can have a feature to visualize releases by dragging sprints into versions (same way as Scrum board) so it can be easier to manage.
fields.summary: Feature request: Drag sprints into version in Kanban Board (like Scrum Board)

fields.description:
COS: 
- Single menu item to mark as done with confirmation dialog

(!) Testing Notes (!) 

Q: Can you reopen the epic via the same menu?
A: (/) No. You must reopen the epic via JIRA View Issue.

Q: Test when Epic status is stale/out of date. Try updating and dragging epic around.
A: (/) Marking an epic as Done when the state is stale will have no ill effect, as the issue still exists. Ranking similarly is okay. Adding an issue to an epic that has since been removed will work but then afterwards the epic will disappear.

Q: What happens when the last issue in a completed epic is deleted/removed?
A: (/) Behaves as normal?

Q: Will updating the status affect quick/instant filters on that epic?
A: (/) If an epic is selected (filtering active) and then marked as done, that filter will be removed. Should not affect any other filters.

Q: Can you change the statuses of the epic in any way? Deleting, renaming the status and messing up the epic?
A: (/) Yes - the "options" are configurable from JIRA's Custom Field admin UI (Configure). It will continue to work until there is only one option left. It will pick the "last" option as the one to set when marking as Done.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to easily see and update the Epic Status of an epic in Plan Mode
As a user, I would like to see the Epic Status of an epic in Plan Mode

fields.description:
This would be based on the value of the Epic Status field, not the workflow status.

See sub-task re: writing an upgrade task.

COS: 
- Show a confirmation dialog when a user updates an Epic to done in Plan mode (y) This has been done as part of GHS-6372
- Upgrade task to convert all existing Epics with a resolution set to have Epic Status or Done, any existing Epics with no status set to ToDo
- Epic label on an issue (and in detail view) should still show even if the parent is not shown in the Epic panel
fields.summary: As a user, I would like for "Done" epics to not show up in Plan Mode

fields.description:
It appears that since last Friday, our existing Sprint (Bug-Fix-1) has just disappeared from our Scrum Board: https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=315&view=planning&selectedIssue=CRUC-5731&epics=visible

This sprint was in progress and we were tracking our work there.

I did do some tidying up of other, old, out of date boards, on Friday - could that have affected the single Sprint on this one Board ?

I also note that GreenHopper appears to be updated since last Friday ? Has that had an effect ?

Is there any chance we can recover the current sprint in this board - Bug-Fix-1 so we can complete it please ?


Cheers,
Nick
fields.summary: Our current sprint suddenly disappeared from our Board
Korean Dates don't work

fields.description:
Currently, the "Epic Label" field is only made "Required" in the Default Field Configuration. This logic needs to change to include any Field Configuration that is used for the Epic issue type in a project.

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Does this logic also extend to recreation of the Epic Label field after it is deleted?
A: (/) Yes. When the field is re-created it is again made Required.

Q: What if there is another field/scheme with a duplicate name? Are we referencing both by ID?
A: (/) Field configurations are referenced by ID.
fields.summary: Epic Label requireness must apply to all relevant Field Configurations, not just the Default

fields.summary: Automate updates to GreenHopper files for help links
Allow the use of "issueid in futureSprint('<sprint name>', <rapid board name>')" to query issues in future sprint
Allow the use of Sprint was in "<sprint name>:<sprint date>" to find issues that were in a sprint in JQL

COS: 
- Must autocomplete
-- Autocomplete options are rendered with *Sprint Name - Start Date (ID)*
-- When choosing an option from autocomplete, it boils down to the sprint ID
- Must accept 'sprint = "name"'  (even if they are not unique) and 'sprint = id'

Show mini avatar for assignee on story (above project avatar) and for sub tasks (in sub tasks tab)
As a scrum team, I would like the ability to see pictures of the assigned individual (if any) on the planning board.

fields.description:
As a user, it is difficult to have to choose exclusively between points and time estimation.

In particular:
- When choosing points, I still may want to have a quick access in the Quick View for a task to log time (the same one that is present when choosing Time Estimation)
- Whether I choose points or time estimation, I still want to be able to see the burndown in both time and points, depending on what's important to me
fields.summary: As a User, I want time and point estimations not to be exclusive

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Earlier versions of JIRA Agile (before JIRA 6.4.0.3) Are unable to track the user who closed a sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Close an Agile Sprint.
# Attempt to locate who Closed the Sprint.

h3. Expected Results
There should be some method to see who closed the Sprint.

h3. Actual Results
Details of who closed the Sprint are never recorded.

h3. Notes
In more recent versions of JIRA Agile (6.4.5+), you are able to determine who closed the Sprint by clicking the *Reports* button from the Agile board, and reviewing the details under the *Sprint Report* heading. Sprints closed with previous versions of JIRA Agile will not record a User within this information regardless of the current running version of JIRA Agile
fields.summary: Ability to keep track of the user who closes a sprint

fields.description:
The Greenhopper Simplified Workflow does not contain any Conditions for workflow transitions. With that, if you have the Browse Issues permission set to Group(Anyone) it means that anonymous users are able to transition issues. 

Reproduce:
# Setup new Project with Greenhopper Simplified Workflow
# Configure Project Permissions to allow Group(Anyone) the Browse Issues permission
# Log out of JIRA and you are able to transition issues

It seems like there should be some conditions to the workflow transitions as in the default jira workflow where 'Only the assignee of the issue can execute this transition.'
fields.summary: Greenhopper Simplified Workflow transition conditions
Time-range picker for CFD unusable as inline-dialog closes before new value can be applied.
Classic Stats Burndown Gadget - cannot select stats field

fields.description:
I've been making some reports and have been having to manually add trendlines to extrapolate where we will be in the future and when we are likely to hit our goals.

It would be really good if GreenHopper could add something like this
fields.summary: Trendlines on reports

fields.description:
We use sub-tasks to break down our work into implementable chunks. It would be useful to be able to drag these sub-tasks into the sprint from the planning board. The alternative is to use something like ALM structure, but it has more complexity than we need. Just being able to see sub-tasks in the backlog (possibly indented under the parent), and drag them into a sprint would be ideal.

Without this capability, we are not able to plan sprints appropriately.
fields.summary: Ability to see sub-tasks in the planning board, and move these into the sprint

fields.description: When choosing the Issue Count as an Estimation Statistic on the Rapid board, sub-tasks are not taken under consideration. It would be a great feature to have the sub-tasks counting on this statistic.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I'd like to have the sub-tasks taken under consideration on the Issue Count Estimation Statistic
'Classic Task Board' drag and drop broken in IE8

fields.description: Commits from BitBucket and that other one within the details view in GreenHopper. This is another issue tab panel that will now be visible within GreenHopper.
fields.summary: Add commits tab to GreenHopper details view in DVCS connector

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Spin up an JIRA OnDemand a la carte instance, use e.g. ondemand-fireball-jira-master-681
* Create a project and a project admin
* Login as project admin
* Click on the cog
* Select _JIRA Admin_
* *Bug:* you can see the Greenhopper configuration; clicking on any of the links will redirect you to the dashboard

First investigation:
* There is a agile_section web-section
* Which is aliased in the jira-ondemand-theme-plugin (studio_agile_section_alias)
* When evaluating the web-section during runtime, there are no conditions
fields.summary: Greenhopper configuration shows up in JIRA OnDemand administration for project admins

fields.description: Timebox: 1.5 days
fields.summary: Spike how to get all of the subs for parents matched in the filter

fields.description:
Currently on GDOG, dragging 4 issues into an epic takes ~10 seconds for the issue count in the epic to update.

(?) This will need to update *all* statistics shown for a given epic -- see comments.

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: We should write a soke test for this and try out the difference before and after the changes with varying sizes of data.
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What calculations will be made on the client side?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Will these calculations impact other client side operations, or otherwise affect responsiveness?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Will need to be checked in all browsers.
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: As a user, I want improved performance of epic issue statistics updates because I want up-to-date data

fields.description:
COS: 
- Implement icon bar on the left
- Continuous page 
- Headings for sections that didn't have headings before (i.e. a heading for each tab)
- Selection status for visible section
- Clicking on the icon scrolls to that section
- Remembered state of the Detail View when navigating through issues or modes (current functionality - don't break it!)


(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: Make sure this plays well with all existing functionality, such as keyboard shortcuts and moving tabs.
A: (/) We need to remember the currently selected 'tab' when moving to the next issue or returning to the mode.

Q: How do third party icons affect this layout?
A: (/) The icons will occupy the same space which is a maximum of 16px x 16px

Q: How will resizing of large inline edit fields like the Description field play with the new continuous page and jump navs?
A: (/) It will move the content below relative to the change in size.

Q: Will users be able to switch back if they don't like it?
A: (/) They'll all like it ;-) There is no option for legacy versions, only for continuous improvement.

Q: Do the jump navs work ok when zoomed and at all supported window sizes?
A: (/) Window size should not make a difference, though resizing will be taken into account for the size of the detail view content.

Q: Does tabbing through the tabs still work?
A: (/) They won't be tabs, but they'll be accessible using the tab key as before.

Q: What if some fields are hidden from the default screen (like Description)?
A: (x) They should be hidden.
R: Please test this.

Q: Are the icons always hidden when the detail view is closed? Should they be displayed?
A: (/) They will be hidden since they are within the container that is removed.

Q: What happens when the item counts exceed the available space?
A: (/) Unlikely with expected usage but expected behaviour is to overflow into content area. Clipping or ellipsis would not help much. We can fit 5 digit numbers before this occurs.

Q: What happens when the nav items exceed the available space?
A: (/) Unlikely with expected usage but possible as there's a plugin point there. After a point they would be clipped and unavailable to click. Content can be accessed by scrolling.

Q: Does the Detail View render ok when no issue is selected?
A: (/) Yes, note the DV has a single column in this state for Plan mode. In Work mode it closes.
fields.summary: Implement 'Jump Nav' (vertical icons for tabs which jump to the part on the continuous page)
Show assignment of work in a sprint

fields.description:
Reproduce steps are listed here. https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-2810

If Greenhopper has a valid license, this doesn't happen. If it doesn't, it causes those add-ons to disable.

Also mentioned in the comments is https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/PLUG-903. I feel like that how the dynamic linking is done is causing this issue.
fields.summary: Installation of Greenhopper without a license causes certain plugins to disable on upm update
Sub tasks not included by the Board's or Swimlane's filter should still be displayed if the parent is displayed

fields.description:
COS: 
- Put at bottom like 'Give Feedback' in JIRA
- Continue saying 'Give GreenHopper Feedback'
- Apply same treatment to BTF
fields.summary: Restore the feedback link in the ROTP header

fields.description: Customer is going to Agile board, but where they used to click on Agile and have GH automatically load, there is now an extra step in the process because Agile is a menu, not a link.  Would like to have link functionality restored.
fields.summary: Have "Agile" button in new RoTP header be a link to Greenhopper
Flagged is only applicable for Classic Planning board and Classic Task board
As a user I would like to add an issue to a sprint from the Issue Navigation Dialog

fields.description: The chart board is using illogical values for the time axis when configured for hours. At the moment we have the time axis set to 44, 88, 132, 176 and so on... a more logical hour view would have been 50, 100, 150 and so on. If possible, make it configurable.
fields.summary: Greenhoppers chart board view uses illogical values for the time axis when configured for hours

fields.description:
At the moment, you can only create new issue through the {{+Create Issue}} link on the top right. 

However, when a user is on the "Plan" tab when creating a sprint, it would be nice to have additional "Create Issue" shortcut around the tabs area.  

!createissue.png!
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have additional button to create new issue

fields.description:
Please provide a plugin module for a "Report". 

We can hack around this in JS by adding our chart types but it would be nice to have this supported.

How I see this is that a developer adds a <gh-rapid-report> to atlassian-plugin.xml. The attributes are title, description, thumbnail, and controller.

The init charts method can fetch these modules with REST and populate the report menus instead of hardcoding them as it does now.

This is essential functionality since the integration story with GreenHopper is kind of broken after the move to Rapid Boards.
fields.summary: As a plugin developer I would like to provide custom reports in Rapid boards
Improve epic linking code to not perform multiple re-indexes
Adding issue(s) to an epic should give immediate feedback

fields.description: Some of our Scrum masters have asked how they can export the current work boards contents. We tried to workaround this by filtering on 'sprint' but it appears we couldn't sort, or filter on sprint=xxx
fields.summary: Ability to Sort on 'Sprint' and to export sprint contents to excel/xml etc

fields.description:
While using the Kanban board, we still need to be able to view the work logged against the tickets, as well as the original estimates. This is specially useful when we want to track the time spent in a ticket and we need to double check if we have logged it already or not. 

Currently, we need to open the regular issue details page, check the work log, add the time if required and go back to the board.
fields.summary: In Kanban, we need to be able to view the work logged in the issue details panel

fields.description:
Customers continually get stuck on situations where issues are not showing up on their Kanban/Scrum boards, can there please be some form of warning coming up if the boards are seen to be empty.

This can happen possibly for the following reasons:
* Version field is hidden
* Work Sub-Filter
* Ranking field is hidden

Can some of these pointers be put in a warning message if the board is seen to be empty
fields.summary: Cannot see issues on board - Please show a warning of why
Adding an issue to an epic does not reindex the issue

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master I would like to have cumulative remaining hours on Rapid Board Work Mode, just like Classic Task Board.
This will be really helpful for a Scrum Master to determine how much each of team member is committed for the Sprint.

See attached screenshots for a better understanding:

!Classic Task Board.png|thumbnail!

Has the cumulative remaining hours per assignee as you can set on filters;

!Plan Mode - Rapid Board.png|thumbnail!

Has the cumulative remaining hours, but it is based on the Sprint and doesn't change if selected a Quick Filter;

!Work Mode - Rapid Board.png|thumbnail!

You can count manually but this would be a hard work if you have loads of issues per user.
fields.summary: Cumulative remaining hours on Rapid Board Work Mode
Epic Label custom field must be mandatory

fields.description: The scrum board has an instant filter in the plan mode, where you can just start typing reduce the amount of issues displayed. I would like to have this functionality available in the work mode as well, so it can also be used for kanban boards.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to use an instant filter on a Kanban Bord in work mode
Need validation of the selected epic, if it's no longer present reset

fields.description: You have to refresh the page with Plan Mode selected, not start on Work and then switch to Plan.
fields.summary: Updating active sprint on Plan Mode causes error

fields.description:
Allow moving sprints on Scrum Boards by drag-drop.

In our conventions, each sprint targets a specific feature, that we work to implement. Sometimes re-prioritization occurs. It would be nice if we could just change the order of already planned sprints quickly.

One can, of course, move the contents of sprints already, but it soon becomes cumbersome if you need to move items from sprint A into B and from B into C and from C into A etc. It would be simply more convenient to allow re-ordering the sprints themselves.
fields.summary: Allow moving sprints with a drag-drop
Add analytics for sample data

fields.description: On the Agile Report board for Kickass - there are 16 Sprints... however only the last 7 sprints are shown in the Velocity Chart.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart only shows the last 7 sprints

fields.description:
# Go to a chart
# click on the date at the top of the board to bring up the date selector menu
# select any dates under custom
# attempt to use a custom time to view the board over
# the time is not updated. (bug)

It is expected that the time is updated.

This appears to be new in 6.0.6-SNAPSHOT or 6.0.5.
fields.summary: Cannot set time range on charts on Cumulative Flow Diagram on Scrum Board

fields.description: I have a filter with just over 200 issues. Just over 100 are displayed on the rapid board and cumulative progress charts.
fields.summary: Not all issues displayed by scrum board and associated charts

fields.description: Currently it is listed last.
fields.summary: Epic Link field should show above all custom detail view fields configured for that board

fields.description:
* Show a success message with a link to the issue view

Must be applied both when "Create epic" button is used as well as regular Quick Create / C keyboard shortcut.

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if the epic was added to another project not on the board?
A: The message is displayed

Q: What if the board is multi-project and an epic is added to one of these projects?
A: The message is shown regardless of whether the epic is on the screen or not
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see some feedback after creating an epic on Plan Mode

fields.description: This needs to be done for 5.2 compatibility. See linked issues for more information.
fields.summary: Alter summary field on New Card dialog to disallow multiple line input
Epic Issue count does not update when issues are added/removed from the epic
Change description of Epic label field from "Epic Label field for GreenHopper use only." to "Provide a short name to identify this Epic in the GreenHopper boards."

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Make sure to test opening the inline edit, making a change, and the following actions:
Clicking other inline edits (x)
Closing the epics or detail panel (x)
Switching modes (x)
Drag and Drop (x)
Create/Delete sprints (x)
Reordering epics (x)
Multi-select (x)
Opening the tools menu (x)
Applying quick/instant filters(x)
Creating a new issue (x)
Create a new epic (x)
Anything I'm missing (?)

Q: Test that foreign character's work
A: (/) UTF-8 characters work; no XSS

Q: Try long but reasonable input
A: (/) Input is limited to a reasonable length

Q: Does tab submit as well?
A: (/) Yes but does not initiate inline edit of next epic, which I think is okay
fields.summary: Allow inline edit of Epic label
As a Product owner I would like to specify the start and end dates when planning the next Sprints in the Plan tab of the rapid board

fields.description: Inline edit exists for some fields; however, it would be very beneficial, especially when in work or plan mode, to be able to edit any field on the issue details screen, including those that are custom fields to avoid having to open it for edit.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to edit the Issue Details without having to open it up to edit

fields.description: See the screenshot
fields.summary: Clicking on 'New Card' from classic board results HTML code in the 'New Card' screen's title

fields.summary: Clicking on 'Create Issue' from classic boards results in 500 error

fields.description:
COS: 
- Allow dragging of the story but make sure that the droppable area in the backlog does not indicate anything that might make the user think they were dropping the story from the sprint

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Can you multi-select issues and drag them into an epic from the active sprint?
A: (/) Yes

Q: What if you multi-select issues from both the active sprint and from the backlog and drag to an epic?
A: (x) We can't do that, should we ?

Q: What if the epics panel is collapsed and you drag to it?
A: (/) Works the same way it would if it was open

Q: What happens when you drag to the edges of the screen?
A: (/) If there is non visible space it scrolls, nothing else

Q: What if the issues from the active sprint are already in another epic when you drag to a new one?
A: (/) The issue is affected to the new epic

Q: What if a quick/instant filter is on while dragging?
A: (/) Issues are filtered out and not selectable

Q: Any difference if the Epic is expanded or collapsed?
A: (/) No
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to add issues in an active sprint to an epic
After creating epics with create epic form, revert the regular Quick Create form to the last used issue type (before epics were created)

fields.description:
Currently we have to query the change history according to the status name (as this was the only thing available in the index), which causes huge problems when a user renames a status or when a client anonymizes the change history data.

5.2 seems to also have stored/indexed by the status id, which would allow us to correctly load the status history even when status names changes.

Investigate to see whats possible
fields.summary: Status change history service should query by status id instead of name

fields.summary: Adding Epic Link to a Screen makes Quick Edit throw errors
Show a sensible default colour for existing epics in the Epic Panel

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

# Epics flag is off
# Drag an epic from backlog into active sprint
# Enable epics flag

Epic continues to show in active sprint issues in Plan Mode.
fields.summary: Epics appear in list of Active Sprint issues if they were added before flag was enabled
If the filter for a board is deleted, still allow it to be managed so that I can change the filter
